New Records: Anthony Volpe became the first player in Series history with a grand slam and a pair of stolen bases in one game
Key Match Events: Volpe's third-inning grand slam sparked the Yankees to an 11-4 win over the Dodgers
Wells and Gleyber Torres added homers for the Yankees
Freddie Freeman homered for his sixth straight Series game
Game 5 is Wednesday night, with the Yankees ace Gerrit Cole and the Dodgers' Jack Flaherty meeting in a rematch of Game 1
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said after his first World Series win as New York's manager
Freddie Freeman said he'll look back on his home run streak after hopefully they win and get this thing done tomorrow
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays were not mentioned but the game was played on a sellout crowd of 49,354
The Yankees stopped a seven-game Series losing streak against the Dodgers dating to 1981
Volpe was interviewed after the game by former Yankees captain Derek Jeter, now a Fox broadcaster
